titleStmt.title: Close Roll for 25 Henry VIII (22 April 1533 to 21 April 1534).

msIdentifier.msName: Chancery and Supreme Court of Judicature: Close Rolls

div.p:
Nicholaus Thorne de Villa Bristollie mercator frater et heres Roberti Thorne mercatoris defuncti coram domino Rege in Cancellaria sua
personaliter constitutus recognouit se debere eidem domino Regi quinquemillia librarum sterlingorum soluendis eidem domino Regi
heredibus executoribus et assignatis suis vicesimo die Julij proxime futuro Et nisi fecerit concessit quod dicta pecunia levetur de terris et cata[llis]
suis ubicumque inventa fuerint infra regnum Angliae vel alibi Teste Rege apud Westmonasterium xxvj die Novembris Nicholas Thorne of the town of Bristol, merchant, brother and heir of Robert Thorne, deceased merchant, appeared in person before the Lord King in his Chancery acknowledged himself to owe the same Lord King five thousand pounds which is to be paid to the same Lord King, his heirs, executors and assigns the twentieth day of July next coming. And unless he will do this he has granted that the said money may be raised of his lands and chattels wheresoever they are found withing the kingdom of England and elsewhere. Witness by the King at Westminster the 26th day of November.

The condicion of this recognisaunce is such that if the above bounden Nicholas his heires and executors do hold k[epe]
observe obey performe and fulfill all and singler such clauses articles and other thynges as of their partie and behalf[e]
air to be holden done kept observed obeyed performed and fulfilled conteyned and specifyed in a decree remaynyng
in the Kynges Court of Chauncery made by the right honrablehonrable Sir Thomas Audeley Knyght Lord Chauncellor of Englond
upon a bill of complaynt exhibite in theseid Court of Chauncery by the above named Nicholas ageynstageynst Emanuell
Lucar Paule Wythypoll and Robert Pakyngton in manner and forme as in the same decre is exprssed expressed and declared as
thesame decree beryng date the xxiijthxxiijth day of November in the xxvthxxvth yere of kyng henry the viijthviijth more playnly appereth
that then this recognisaunce to be voide and none effect or elles to stand and be alwey in his full power
strenght and vertue /

Idem Nicholaus coram domino Rege in Cancellaria sua personaliter constitutus recognouit se debere prefato domino Regi mille
libras sterlingorum soluendis &c etc. Et nisi fecerit &cetc. Ut supra supra The same Nicholas appeared in person before the Lord King in his Chancery acknowledged himself to owe the aforesaid Lord King one thousand pounds etc. And unless he will do this etc. As above.

The condicion of this recognisaunce is such that if the abovebounden Nicholas his heres and executors at all
tymes hereafter discharge acquyte and save harmelesse theabove named Emanuell his executors and administrators
and every of them ayenst all and every person and persons of and for all such dettes sumez of money and other thyngis
which they or any of them shall hereafter by any maner of meanys clayme aske or demaunde of theseid
Emanuell his executors or administrators by reason of any dett legacy dewty or accompt of the above named
Robert Thorne decessed or by reason or occasion of the testament and last will of thesame Robert except only such
dettes duties and legacies which be lymyted and assigned to be payed by theseid Emanuell by a decree made in
the Kynges Court of Chauncery barying date the xxiij day of November in the xxvthxxvth yere of the reigne of Kyng Henry
the Viijthviijth made by the right honorable Sir Thomas Audeley Knyght Lord Chaunceller of Englond upon a bill
of complaynt exhibited to the Lord Chaunceler in the Kynges Court of Chauncery by theseid Nicholas ageynst
theseid Emanuell Powle Wythypoll and Robert Payyngton as by the same decree remaynyng in theseid
Court of Chauncery more playnly appereth of Recorde that then this recognysaunce to be voide and of non effect
or elles to stand and be in his full strength and vertue /

Idem Nicholaus coram domino Rege in Cancellaria sua personaliter constitutus recognouit se debere prefato domino Regi
ducentas marcas sterlingorum soluendis &c etc. Et nisi fecerit &cetc. Ut supra supra The same Nicholas appeared in person before the Lord King in his Chancery acknowledged himself to owe the aforesaid Lord King one two hundred marks etc. And unless he will do this etc. As above.

The condicion of this recognisaunce is such Wher theseid Emmanuell is appoynted by a decree made in the kynges
Court of Chauncery to delyver to the above bounden Nicholas as moche plate as amounteth to the some of one
hundreth poundes sterlyng to the use of Robert Thorne son of theseid Nicholas in contentacion and satissfaction of one
hundreth poundes sterlyng bequethed to the seid Robert Thorne the son by the testament and last Will
of the seid Robert Thorne decessed if theseid Nicholas his heirez and executors havyng theseid plate delyvered
dyscharge save and kepe harmeles theseid Emanuell his executors and administrators and every of them ageyne
theseid Robert Thorne the son and for theseid C li sterlyng bequethed to hym by theseid Robert
Thorne decessed by theseid testament and last Will of thesame Robert Thorne the testator and of and
for every parte and parcell of the same that then this present recognysaunce to be voide and of none
effect or elles to stand and be alwayes in his full power strength and vertue /

Emanuell Lucar mercator coram domino Rege in Cancellaria sua
personaliter constitutus recognouit se debere Nicholao
Thorne de Villa Bristollie mercatori fratri &et heredi Roberti Thorne mercatoris defuncti mille libras sterlingorum
Soluendis eidem Nicholao executoribus et assignatis suis decimo octavo die Decembris proxime futuro Et nisi fecerit &cetc. Teste Rege apud Westmonasterium xj die Decembris Emanuel Lucar, merchant, appeared in person before the Lord King in his Chancery acknowledged himself to owe to Nicholas Thorne of the town of Bristol, merchant, brother and heir of Robert Thorne, deceased merchant, one thousand pounds sterling of money to the said Nicholas, his executors and heirs, the 18th dat of December next coming. And unless he will do this etc. Witness by the King at Westminster the 11th day of December.

The condicion of this recognisaunce is such that if the above bounde Emanuell Lucar do well and truely
perfourme fulfyll &and kepe all and singular suche articles as be comprised in a decree beryng date xxiijthxxiijth day of
November in the xxvth xxvth yere of kyng Henry the Viijth viijth made by the right honrable honrable Sir Thomas Audeley Knight
Lord Chaunceller of Englond in the matter of variaunce betwene the above named Nicholas Thorne and the
seid Emanuell Lucar &and other which of the part of theseid Emanuell ought to be performed fulfilled and kepte
that then this recognysauns to be voide or elles to stand in his full strenght and vertue /
